question_text: Select two use cases for cross-platform virtualization.
answer_options: Running Windows-specific apps on a Mac system
Sharing CPU load across physical servers
Maintaining security baselines in mobile devices
Running Linux tools on a Windows host
correct_answer: Running Windows-specific apps on a Mac system
Running Linux tools on a Windows host
explanation: Cross-platform virtualization allows different OSes to run on the same host, enabling app compatibility across platforms.
